title: Let the Games Begin - Again! 'Squid Game' - Season 2 Official Trailer
description: "I'm trying to put an end to this game." Are you ready to play? Netflix has revealed the main official trailer for Squid Game 2, the second season of the hit Korean thriller series Squid Game from 2021. It's a direct continuation following 456 who returns to the game - with a sneaky plan in mind. Three years after winning, Player 456 gives up going to America and comes back with a new resolution to put at end to this vicious game. Gi-hun once again dives into the mysterious survival game, starting another life-or-death game with new participants gathered to win the prize of ₩45.6 billion. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk returns to write & direct. Actors Lee Jung-jae, Lee Byung-hun, Wi Ha-jun, & Gong Yoo reprise their roles from Season 1 - joined by new cast members: Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Park Gyu-young, Lee Jin-uk, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Lee David, Choi Seung-hyun, Roh Jae-won, Jo Yu-ri, and Won Ji-an. This new trailer hints at this sequel being quite darker, angrier, and more bleak as 456 realizes everyone is just extremely greedy & selfish. It seems to be meta commentary on the huge success of the first season and […]
author: Alex Billington

text: by November 26, 2024Source: YouTube "I'm trying to put an end to this game." Are you ready to play? Netflix has revealed the main official trailer for Squid Game 2, the second season of the hit Korean thriller series Squid Game from 2021. It's a direct continuation following 456 who returns to the game - with a sneaky plan in mind. Three years after winning, Player 456 gives up going to America and comes back with a new resolution to put at end to this vicious game. Gi-hun once again dives into the mysterious survival game, starting another life-or-death game with new participants gathered to win the prize of ₩45.6 billion. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk returns to write & direct. Actors Lee Jung-jae, Lee Byung-hun, Wi Ha-jun, & Gong Yoo reprise their roles from Season 1 - joined by new cast members: Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Park Gyu-young, Lee Jin-uk, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Lee David, Choi Seung-hyun, Roh Jae-won, Jo Yu-ri, and Won Ji-an. This new trailer hints at this sequel being quite darker, angrier, and more bleak as 456 realizes everyone is just extremely greedy & selfish. It seems to be meta commentary on the huge success of the first season and Netflix turning it into a real game - as if no one learned any lessons. Oh yes let's go - bring it on. Here's the full official trailer (+ poster) for Netflix's series Squid Game - Season 2, direct from YouTube: You can rewatch the teaser trailer for Netflix's Squid Game - Season 2 right here to view the first look again. For more info + updates, follow Squid Game Facebook page or IG @squidgamenetflix. The countdown is on. "There's no stopping the game." Three years after winning Squid Game, Player 456 gave up leaving Korea and comes back with a new resolution in his mind. Gi-hun once again dives into the mysterious survival game, starting another life-or-death game with new participants gathered to win the prize of 45.6 billion won. Squid Game is a series created and written and directed by Korean filmmaker Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of the filmsMy Father, Silenced, Miss Granny, The Fortress, plus Season 1 of Squid Game, which also won him an Emmy for Outstanding Directing. Produced by Firstman Studio in Korea. The first season premiered on Netflix in September 2021. The third & final season will debut sometime in 2025. Executive produced by Kim Ji-yeon, Hwang Dong-hyuk. Netflix will be debuting Squid Game - Season 2 streaming on Netflix worldwide starting December 26th, 2024 at the end of this year. Who's ready to start watching? Find more posts: To Watch, Trailer
html:
by
November 26, 2024
Source: YouTube

"I'm trying to put an end to this game." Are you ready to play? Netflix has revealed the main official trailer for Squid Game 2, the second season of the hit Korean thriller series Squid Game from 2021. It's a direct continuation following 456 who returns to the game - with a sneaky plan in mind. Three years after winning, Player 456 gives up going to America and comes back with a new resolution to put at end to this vicious game. Gi-hun once again dives into the mysterious survival game, starting another life-or-death game with new participants gathered to win the prize of ₩45.6 billion. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk returns to write & direct. Actors Lee Jung-jae, Lee Byung-hun, Wi Ha-jun, & Gong Yoo reprise their roles from Season 1 - joined by new cast members: Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Park Gyu-young, Lee Jin-uk, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Lee David, Choi Seung-hyun, Roh Jae-won, Jo Yu-ri, and Won Ji-an. This new trailer hints at this sequel being quite darker, angrier, and more bleak as 456 realizes everyone is just extremely greedy & selfish. It seems to be meta commentary on the huge success of the first season and Netflix turning it into a real game - as if no one learned any lessons. Oh yes let's go - bring it on.

Here's the full official trailer (+ poster) for Netflix's series Squid Game - Season 2, direct from YouTube:

You can rewatch the teaser trailer for Netflix's Squid Game - Season 2 right here to view the first look again.

For more info + updates, follow Squid Game Facebook page or IG @squidgamenetflix. The countdown is on.

"There's no stopping the game." Three years after winning Squid Game, Player 456 gave up leaving Korea and comes back with a new resolution in his mind. Gi-hun once again dives into the mysterious survival game, starting another life-or-death game with new participants gathered to win the prize of 45.6 billion won. Squid Game is a series created and written and directed by Korean filmmaker Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of the filmsMy Father, Silenced, Miss Granny, The Fortress, plus Season 1 of Squid Game, which also won him an Emmy for Outstanding Directing. Produced by Firstman Studio in Korea. The first season premiered on Netflix in September 2021. The third & final season will debut sometime in 2025. Executive produced by Kim Ji-yeon, Hwang Dong-hyuk. Netflix will be debuting Squid Game - Season 2 streaming on Netflix worldwide starting December 26th, 2024 at the end of this year. Who's ready to start watching?

Find more posts: To Watch, Trailer
